errors.error_description: The installation instructions show the `pip install` command before the virtual environment is created and activated. This will install the package in the global Python environment, not the isolated one.
correction_candidates: Move the '$ pip install --upgrade holidays' command to be the last line in the sequence.
Combine the commands into a single line: '$ python3 -m venv venv && source venv/bin/activate && pip install --upgrade holidays'.
Remove the virtual environment commands, as they are optional.
errors.golden_answer: Move the '$ pip install --upgrade holidays' command to be the last line in the sequence.

errors.error_description: The README incorrectly states that the library only supports Python 3.7. The PyPI badge shows support for a wider range of Python versions (3.8, 3.9, 3.10, 3.11, 3.12).
correction_candidates: Change the sentence to 'Note: This library currently only supports Python 3.7 and above.'
Remove the sentence 'Note: This library currently only supports Python 3.7.'
Change the sentence to 'Note: This library supports Python 2.7 and 3.7.'
Update the Python versions badge to only show support for Python 3.7.
errors.golden_answer: Remove the sentence 'Note: This library currently only supports Python 3.7.'
